column4: hi there. I've updated my ubuntu yesterday, but did no choose to update to maveric. Today it got down and when i try to start it, it goes to a dark place, where initramfs rules :S any idea?
not sure, he does not talk to me :s
any idea on how to fix it?
I did not understand your problem, other than moving your computer to the dark place(France, I assume, to quote John Adams)
If your system is not booting the GUI up, try going to a virtual console, login and do the updates from there.

well, yesterday i had made the updates on synaptic, and today my pc crashed. Now when i turn it on, i get a black screen, with errors telling that /root/dev, root/sys and /root/proc failed, the easybox message and initramfs terminal :s
If you are lucky, you just need to fsck the root partition.  Boot up with a CD drive, and run fsck on your root partition.
try withou t install, right? Doing it
it's taking so long to load ubuntu from cd :s Can it damage if i remove the cd to try again, or is it normal to take so many time?
does not loads, it remains loading. is there anythin that i can make in initramfs comand line?

This error occurs during the boot.  Prior to this point, there is an opportunity to choose a kernel.  Try booting with a different kernel.  I gor Lucid trying to boot a PAE kernel somehow and it would die just like yours.  Booting an earlier kernel worked for me.
but i don't get the option to choose a prior kernel, it simply goes there directly
Press the Shift key at the right time during boot.  You may have to try it a few times.  In my case, I booted with Knoppix, and edited /boot/grub/grub.cfg to make that menu unhidden.
my too kernels gives the same error :s
That's all I have at the moment.  Sorry.
thanls anyway. i only have acces to the grub menu. Searching what i can do from there
